name: Lower Body Dressing
description: The ability to dress & undress below the waist, including fasteners. Does not include footwear.
exceptions: Not about putting on & removing clothes patient usually does not wear (eg, does patient usually wear a belt?)
tips: Patient can be sitting or standing
Ask patient to put on pants, fasten as appropriate (button, zip), & then remove them
Consider patient's usual performance, not the lowest
dependent: The patient may lean forwards, backwards, may be able to use bedside rails, may be able to raise legs to thread a pant leg/skirt, but helper does all the effort to put on/remove the LB garment & patient contributes no effort to the task.
substantial: Patient participates in putting on/removing LB clothing, but helper provides >50% the effort
Patient is able to bring garment together once it is put on, but is unable to fasten, snap, belt or button it
Patient is able to get one leg in/out of underwear & pant sleeve/skirt but not both legs
Patient is able to start the task of putting on or taking off underwear & pants/skirt, but is unable to complete the task of threading/removing legs through underwear & pant sleeves/skirt
partial: Patient participates in putting on/removing LB clothing, but helper provides <50% the effort
Patient is able to put on garments but is unable to fasten, snap, belt or button it
Patient is unable to unbutton/unfasten/unsnap/unbelt garments, but is able to remove them
Patient can pull up underwear & pants/skirt or pull down, but is unable to thread/remove both legs through underwear & pant sleeves/skirt
supervision: Prompting & cueing for sequencing to fully accomplish LB dressing are required
There may be concerns about safety w/completing task w/o falling over which require verbal cues from helper for technique
Touching/Steadying only may be required while putting on/removing underwear & pants or skirt or in fastening buttons, snaps, belt or Velcro.
setup: Helper only assists prior to or following LB dressing.

Patient needs helper for preparation such as handing patient garments or handing patient required equipment such as a zipper pull, buttonholer or in application of orthosis/prosthesis. Patient may need helper to fold clothing & put it away after removal.
independent: Patient puts on the pants/skirt, & can button, snap, Velcro or fasten it, & can unbutton/unfasten/unsnap the skirt or pants, & take it off w/o helper assistance. Patient can use required equipment such as zipper pull, buttonholer.
